an3.140:4.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you about three wild colts and three wild people.
an3.140:4.2: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
an3.140:5.3: but not beautiful or well proportioned.
an3.140:5.4: Another wild colt is quick and beautiful,
an3.140:5.6: While another wild colt is quick, beautiful, and well proportioned.
an3.140:5.7: These are the three wild colts.
an3.140:6.1: And what are the three wild people?
an3.140:6.3: but not beautiful or well proportioned.
an3.140:6.4: Another wild person is quick and beautiful,
an3.140:6.6: While another wild person is quick, beautiful, and well proportioned.
an3.140:7.1: And how is a wild person quick,
an3.140:7.2: but not beautiful or well proportioned?
an3.140:7.3: It’s when a mendicant truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ …
an3.140:7.4: ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
an3.140:7.5: This is how they’re quick, I say.
an3.140:7.6: But when asked a question about the teaching or training, they falter without answering.
an3.140:7.7: This is how they’re not beautiful, I say.
an3.140:7.8: And they don’t receive robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
an3.140:7.9: This is how they’re not well proportioned, I say.
an3.140:7.10: This is how a wild person is quick,
an3.140:7.11: but not beautiful or well proportioned.
an3.140:8.1: And how is a wild person quick and beautiful,
an3.140:8.3: It’s when a mendicant truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ …
an3.140:8.4: ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
an3.140:8.5: This is how they’re quick, I say.
an3.140:8.6: When asked a question about the teaching or training, they answer without faltering.
an3.140:8.7: This is how they’re beautiful, I say.
an3.140:8.8: But they don’t receive robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
an3.140:8.9: This is how they’re not well proportioned, I say.
an3.140:8.10: This is how a wild person is quick and beautiful,
an3.140:9.1: And how is a wild person quick, beautiful, and well proportioned?
an3.140:9.2: It’s when a mendicant truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ …
an3.140:9.3: ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
an3.140:9.4: This is how they’re quick, I say.
an3.140:9.5: When asked a question about the teaching or training, they answer without faltering.
an3.140:9.6: This is how they’re beautiful, I say.
an3.140:9.7: They receive robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
an3.140:9.8: This is how they’re well proportioned, I say.
an3.140:9.9: This is how a wild person is quick, beautiful, and well proportioned.
an3.140:9.10: These are the three wild people.”
